title: Masayuki Maegawa
text:
is a <a href="Japanese%20people">Japanese</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player.
Playing career.
Maegawa was born in <a href="Mie%20Prefecture">Mie Prefecture</a> on 20 June 1984. After graduating from high school, he joined <a href="J1%20League">J1 League</a> club <a href="Kyoto%20Sanga%20FC">Kyoto Purple Sanga</a> in 2003. However he could not play at all in the match. Kyoto also finished at the bottom place in <a href="2003%20J.League%20Division%201">2003 season</a> and was relegated to <a href="J2%20League">J2 League</a>. On 11 September 2004, he debuted as substitute midfielder at the 76th minutes against <a href="Shonan%20Bellmare">Shonan Bellmare</a>. However he could only play this match and left Kyoto end of 2004 season. In 2005, he moved to <a href="Japan%20Football%20League">Japan Football League</a> club <a href="Ehime%20FC">Ehime FC</a>. He played many matches and Ehime won the champions in <a href="2005%20Japan%20Football%20League">2005 season</a>. Although Ehime was promoted to J2 from 2006, he retired end of 2005 season.
